result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

OFF RECORD/ 11:29 AM Defendant David Allen Dvorak in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for David Allen Dvorak.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea/sentencing hearing on December 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:56 AM   Defendant David Allen Dvorak in court.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for David Allen Dvorak. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Pollak states he waives further reading and enters of Not Guilty. Court enters not Not Guilty Plea. Schedules Status Conference.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:00 AM Defendant David Allen Dvorak in court.   Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for David Allen Dvorak.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny  Pollak indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.  State calls witness,  Deputy Culhane, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.     10:02 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.   10:04 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Pollak.    10:05 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Pollak  no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.   Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Arraignment scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak argues bond.  Court sets bond.  Court sets initial appearance for 5/3/22 at 8:30AM.
